name: State_13

timeline_beats.label: Maritime league chartered; shipwright guilds institutionalized
Accidental reef barrage built after catastrophic storm; long-term harbor defense
Joined Coastal Defense Compact and northern fisheries/treaty arrangements

factions.label: Maritime Merchants
factions.influence_hint: Dominant in coastal trade policy; funds reagent imports

factions.label: Harbormaster Guild
factions.influence_hint: Controls port access, piloting, and shipwright standards

factions.label: Coastal Clans
factions.influence_hint: Local landed power; supplies crews and militia levies

factions.label: Naval Militia
factions.influence_hint: State defense; enforces fisheries rules and anti-piracy

factions.label: Scriptoria of Tides
factions.influence_hint: Ritual specialists advising navigators and blessing voyages

constraints: Localized ritual magic requires material components; consumes scarce imported reagents
No instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics
Long-range mind influence rare and institutionally banned
Navigational auguries cannot replace charts and seamanship
Combustion-derived industry limited (no high-pressure steam megatechs)
Must respect inter-state treaty and alliance obligations listed in external_relations_refs
notes: Strategic dependency on imported reagents; merchant factions control supply lines
Key harbor (Port Rekka) sits on a chokepoint protected by artificial reefs
Fisheries subject to T3 sharing rules; enforcement by Naval Militia
Seasonal storms and reef hazards shape ship design and guild regulations
Lower layers must model guild privileges, reagent scarcity, and treaty-driven fishing quotas
